{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is experiencing episodic headaches, dizziness, nausea, and vomiting, suggesting a possible intracranial hypertension. The MRI shows isolated dilation of the left lateral ventricle, which may be caused by blockade of the ventricular outlet. Based on this information, it is likely that the blockage is occurring at the level of the foramen of Monro (interventricular foramen), which is responsible for draining cerebrospinal fluid from the lateral ventricles into the third ventricle.", "answer_choice": "B"}
